title._content: [Portrait of Pee Wee Russell, Muggsy Spanier, Miff Mole, and Joe Grauso, Nick's (Tavern), New York, N.Y., ca. June 1946] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Pee Wee Russell, Muggsy Spanier, Miff Mole, and Joe Grauso, Nick's (Tavern), New York, N.Y., ca. June 1946] 1 negative : b&w ; 3 1/4 x 4 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: Four of Nick's sizzling steaks (Pee Wee Russell, Muggsy Spanier, Miff Mole, Joe Grauso) come out for air after a hot half hour session on the broiler. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 430 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: The Record Changer, v. 5, no. 4 (June 46, 1946), p. 11. Subjects: Russell, Pee Wee Spanier, Muggsy, 1906-1967 Mole, Miff, 1898-1961 Grauso, Joe Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Clarinetists--1940-1950. Cornet players--1940-1950. Trombonists--1940-1950. Nick's (Tavern) Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Cityscape photographs--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print (reference print) Library of Congress, Music Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, loc.gov/rr/perform/ Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.06581 Call Number: LC-GLB13- 0658
